resources.string: Australia is the ____ largest country in the world.
Australia is home to ____ of the top 25 most venomous snakes in the world.
A monotreme is a mammal that lays eggs. Two exist in the world, both Australian. They are? Select two only!
Yes, it snows in Australia. The area of Australia that is covered by snow in winter is larger than the area of ____.
The longest fence in the world was built in Australia to keep dingoes out of grazing land. How long is it?
Which two animals appear in Australia\'s Coat of Arms? Select two only!
Australians like to gamble. What percentage of the adult population enjoys a flutter?
Australia is the lowest continent on earth, with an average height of ____.
What are the coldest and hottest temperatures ever recorded in Australia? Select two only!
Bob Hawke, a former Prime Minister, set a world record for doing what?
What Latin expression meaning \"land belonging to nobody\" was used by Captain Cook to lay claim to Australia?
Catching the world\'s largest recorded barramundi
Sculling 2.5 pints of beer in 11 seconds
Having the world\'s largest collection of BBQ aprons
Identifying the most animal species from animal sounds in a minute
Australia is the 6th largest country in the world, at 7,682,300 km² (2,966,200 miles²).
Australia is home to 20 of the 25 most venomous snakes in the world.
Echidnas and platypus lay eggs in an underground burrow. The eggs typically hatch within 10 days of laying.
Australia has several alpine regions in the south east of the country that receive yearly snowfall suitable for winter sports. The total area that gets snow is larger than Switzerland.
The dingo fence was built during the 1880s and was completed in 1885. It is maintained to this day. It is 5,614 kms (3,488 mi) long.
The kangaroo and emu feature on Australia\'s Coat of Arms. Neither animal can easily move backwards and were chosen to symbolise a nation moving forward.
Around 80% of Australian adults enjoy gambling, and Australia is home to 20% of the worlds poker machines. There are more poker machines in Australia than Nevada.
The average height of Australia is 330 m (1082 ft). Mount Kosciuszko is the highest point (2,228 m / 7,309 ft), Lake Eyre is the lowest point (-15 m / -49 ft) .
A high of 50.7 °C (123.3 °F) was recorded in Oodnadatta, South Australia on January 2nd, 1960. A low of −23.0 °C (−9.4 °F) was recorded in Charlotte Pass, New South Wales on June 29th, 1994.
Bob Hawke entered the Guinness World Book of Records in 1954 for drinking a yard glass of ale (2.5 pints) in 11 seconds at the Turf Tavern, Oxford.
Terra Nullius is a Latin expression meaning "nobody's land", and is a principle sometimes used in international law to describe territory that may be acquired by a state's occupation of it.
